alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Elbert County through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Elbert, or 28 miles northeast of Colorado Springs, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Elbert County, which includes Fondis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
